intro: Monelasmum acutum, commonly known as the sharpleaf monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical with a pointed tip, and it produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Monelasmum acutum is often found in association with other understory plants in humid, temperate forests.
